biography.value:
Thought to be cast-off splinters of Yggdrasil, the World Tree, yggdrasti look like gigantic, dead trees covered with barnacles. They fly through Wildspace and the Astral Sea with their topmost branches leading the way and their withered roots trailing behind them. Each one has its own gravity plane and air envelope.

Creatures sometimes try to hitch a ride on an yggdrasti to take advantage of its air envelope. A typical yggdrasti specimen has cavities inside its trunk in which Medium or smaller creatures can lurk.

Yggdrasti attack any settlements or spelljamming ships they come across without provocation. By using a speak with plants spell or similar magic, someone might be able to convince an yggdrasti to break off its attack, but the monster’s innate hatred of other living things is extremely difficult for it to suppress.

Yggdrasti sometimes make landfall and disguise themselves as ordinary trees, burying their roots in the ground to pull off the deception. They can uproot themselves at any time and use their roots to shamble awkwardly across the ground, but flying is their preferred mode of travel.

description.value:
The yggdrasti makes two Root attacks and uses &Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Discharge (if available).

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 15). The yggdrasti has four roots, each of which can grapple one target.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The yggdrasti shoots &Reference[lightning]{lightning} at one creature within 120 feet of itself. The target must make a [[/save dex 13 format=long]], taking [[/damage 7d8 type=lightning average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Cavities. The yggdrasti has 1d4 + 2 cavities in its trunk. Each cavity is big enough to hold one Medium creature, two Small creatures, or eight Tiny creatures. A creature inside a cavity has three-quarters cover against attacks and other effects that originate outside the cavity. The yggdrasti’s cavities aren’t connected to one another.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

False Appearance. If the yggdrasti is motionless and rooted in the ground at the start of combat, it looks just like a dead tree and has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn’t observed the rooted yggdrasti move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check to discern that the yggdrasti is animate.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

&Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Conduit. If the yggdrasti is subjected to &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage, it is unhurt, and the &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage is instead divided evenly among all creatures it is grappling. In addition, the yggdrasti regains one use of &Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Discharge.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Unusual &Reference[nat]{Nature}. The yggdrasti doesn’t require air or sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
